"Small" and "Tiny" are community driven terms and are are completely subjective. There is no definition for "Small" and "Tiny" parts in KSP. This change simply makes sense for several reasons. 1. The two parts were redundant. 2. There was no probe sized SAS already. 3. It's better to change it while in early access then wait til the game is released.

No, the difference between SAS and ASAS was removed by a complete change to how SAS works some time ago (around 0.23 I believe).

If you want to fix any flights in progress, you should be able to do the following...

1) Make a copy of your save directory and keep it somewhere safe.

2) Open your persistence.sfs file with a plain text editor like notepad (do NOT use word or wordpad).

3) Search (Ctrl+F) for all entries of "sasModule"

4) Replace each entry with "advSasModule"

5) Save the persistence.sfs.

6) Load up your game in KSP.

You can also try the same with the quicksave.sfs, then just load it with the standard F9.

Good luck,
